pros: Amazing paid time off and vacation time.
cons: Very rare for raises, no matter how long you have been here.

pros: A wonderful sense of community on campus, and a lot of first generation college students determined to succeed. Small and friendly campus. Faculty really care here.
cons: Pay is drastically below the national average for corresponding jobs, and below the local average rate of pay for the county. As a result, most faculty teach 5+ classes just to survive. Benefits are getting steadily worse (healthcare OPE are now a minimum of $6k and up to $12k for a family, and retirement is next to nothing). Furthermore, once you're hired, you can expect a maximum raise of 2% per year. This place makes it incredibly hard to survive, and despite multi-million dollar donations, they continue to report financial losses to faculty every year. Hard to be optimistic about the future of this organization or its employees, which is probably why most new employees only stay a couple of years.

review_title: Athlete Oriented - If play, then pass
pros: Small classes, collaborative faculty colleagues, support from staff in other departments, easy to get around campus
cons: Most students are athletes and are there only to play a sport, absolutely no interest in academics or learning, complain routinely to VP of Student Success about grades and no ability to submit late assignments, students do nothing and have no basic skills, many say they are there to only play sports and expect to pass, students have no consequences for poor performance, they spend < 30 minutes per course on homework, about 3 hours per semester per course. Any serious college professor is wasting time - like pushing wet spaghetti noodles over sandpaper.

review_title: Good People - Poor Pay/Low Morale/Threat of Closing
pros: A Lot of good people here - Staff was great about getting together
cons: Small School with limited resources - the risk of the school closing due to financial constraints always felt present

pros: Some of the students and faculty are wonderful
cons: The school's financial hardships make it a challenging place to thrive in

job_title: Independent Grant Writing Contractor/Consultant in Dallas, TX
cons: No longer a Franciscan based University. Low Pay!
